sense.name: make or become physically harder and stronger
sense.examples: These wastes are packed and solidified in radioactive waste containers at nuclear power plants. This solidified the photopolymer. The molten lead droplets fell against a counter-current of forced air that solidified the molten lead.

sense.name: make or become more unified or certain
sense.examples: Before the MS XSLT 2.0 rumors become solidified in concrete by days end read the second sentence. The economic stabilization that was begun last year is being solidified. The regents solidified the law they made under emergency rules, citing students' safety as a paramount concern. This sentiment solidified the party's ranks in the decades following the Civil War.
